title: To Die For Fettuccine Alfredo Recipe
description: Fettuccine Alfredo with Romano and Parmesan cheeses, cream, and butter. This delicious sauce for fettuccine pasta is rich in taste yet simple to make.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Sauces Pasta Sauces Creamy Alfredo To Die For Fettuccine Alfredo 4.7 (2,295) 1,751 Reviews 272 Photos I created this fettuccine Alfredo by modifying my mother's recipe. I get nothing but rave reviews when I make this dish. My boyfriend is a fettuccine Alfredo connoisseur, and he scrapes the pan every time. I must warn you, this recipe is not for the health-conscious! Submitted by ERINMARIE Updated on February 5, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 272 272 272 272 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This rich and creamy fettuccine Alfredo is an easy recipe even for beginner cooks, but it’s impressive enough for company.  How to Make ​​Fettuccine Alfredo You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Fettuccine Alfredo Ingredients These are the simple ingredients you’ll need to make this fettuccine Alfredo recipe:  Pasta: Of course, you’ll need fettuccine pasta. Butter: This Alfredo sauce starts with two sticks of butter. Cream: The rich sauce calls for almost a cup of heavy cream. Seasonings: The fettuccine Alfredo is simply seasoned with salt, pepper, and garlic salt.Cheese: You’ll need Romano and Parmesan cheeses.  How to Make Homemade ​​Fettuccine Alfredo Here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade fettuccine Alfredo: Cook the pasta.Melt the butter and cream together on the stove, season, and stir in the cheese.Toss the pasta in the cheese sauce.  What to Serve With ​​Fettuccine Alfredo Looking for serving inspiration? We’ve got you covered: Appetizers: Balsamic Bruschetta, Toasted Garlic Bread, Fried Stuffed Squash Blossoms  Mix-ins: chicken, shrimp, sausage, green peas, broccoli, mushrooms Side dishes: Classic Restaurant Caesar Salad, Gourmet Mushroom Risotto, Classic Tossed Salad How to Store ​​Fettuccine Alfredo Store your leftover fettuccine Alfredo in an airtight container for up to three days. Reheat gently in the microwave or on the stove. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “I love this recipe,” says MopacRR. “I used canned tomatoes this last time because I was out of fresh ones. Turned out great! I’ve used shrimp with it too. I also like to add bacon crumbles.” “It is so easy to make and is finished in under an hour,” according to Ella Hertzfeld. “Along with the pasta, we enjoy it with a side salad, some garlic bread, and some grilled chicken.” “This recipe is amazing,” raves Cortney Scott. “I will certainly be making this again! It went perfectly with shrimp and broccoli!” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 24 ounces dry fettuccine pasta 1 cup butter ¾ pint heavy cream salt and pepper to taste 1 dash garlic salt ¾ cup grated Romano cheese ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add fettuccine pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Melt butter into cream in a large saucepan over low heat; add salt, pepper, and garlic salt. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Increase the heat to medium; stir in grated Romano and Parmesan cheese until melted and sauce has thickened. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add cooked pasta to sauce and toss until thoroughly coated; serve immediately. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 5,466 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 964 Calories 61g Fat 84g Carbs 24g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 964 % Daily Value * Total Fat 61g 78% Saturated Fat 37g 187% Cholesterol 184mg 61% Sodium 582mg 25% Total Carbohydrate 84g 31% Dietary Fiber 4g 14% Total Sugars 4g Protein 24g 47% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 303mg 23% Iron 3mg 19% Potassium 285mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of To Die For Fettuccine Alfredo 01 of 272 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 272 Photo by  MARIE 12/21/2024 Great flavors Yes, I made the sauce in my Vitamix, came out very delicious very creamy and smooth 03 of 272 Photo by  Peter 11/18/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Easy to make and lots of flavour 04 of 272 Photo by  Valerie Tate 01/03/2024 The instructions regarding the heavy cream are unclear. I added 3/4 cup of heavy cream until I can get more comfortable with the recipe. I was also conservative on adding salt. It was a large batch that I will adjust for a smaller family of 3 in the future. This was my first attempt at making it. All in all, I am pleased with the results. Added garlic shrimp and completed the meal with a side salad and garlic bread. Husband loved it. 05 of 272 Photo by  enriquezlox 12/09/2023 A keeper! Crowd-pleaser Great flavors Easy to follow This is a great recipe and it's easy to make one of my favorites! I added shrimp to mines. 06 of 272 Photo by  BlueYolk8847 11/10/2022 This is the best Alfredo recipe I have ever tried - it really lives up to the name "To Die For." It tasted like restaurant quality. I did read the reviews and made the following adjustments based on those comments, and, the smaller size of my 16oz. box of fettuccini: 1) used 16oz box of fettuccini, 2) added about 1/2 teaspoon of nutmeg, and 3) reduced the amount of better to 3/4 cup, 4) sprinkled on some dried parsley, and went easy on the garlic salt. 07 of 272 Photo by  SassyAhi5099 09/10/2022 This was superb. 08 of 272 Photo by  Emily Grace Burke 08/14/2022 Super easy, quick and delicious!! I added cherry tomatoes and diced roasted green chilies and it was so yummy! Will definitely make this again! 09 of 272 Photo by  Susan Johnston Hoppe 03/30/2022 This is fabulous. I did as others suggested and used half the butter. I also used half and half, since that is what I had and it turned out perfectly. Love, love, love this. 10 of 272 Photo by  SereneMeal7306 03/23/2022 Didn't use Romano cheese, out of stock in the store 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Mushroom Tortellini Alfredo 2 Ratings Lighter Mushroom Tortellini Alfredo 1 Rating Homemade Chicken Fettuccine 252 Ratings Creamy Ham and Asparagus Fettuccine 138 Ratings Instant Pot® Angel Hair Alfredo Pasta 1 Rating Lighter Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo 140 Ratings Cajun Shrimp and Sausage Alfredo 1 Rating Steak and Mushroom Tortellini Alfredo 4 Ratings Instant Pot Chicken Alfredo 6 Ratings Pasta with Chicken and Mushroom Alfredo Sauce 2 Ratings Creamy Sun-Dried Tomato Fettuccine 2 Ratings Pesto Delicato di Camogli Chicken Alfredo Heart-Shaped Pizza 1 Rating Alfredo for a Crowd 2 Ratings Quick One-Pot Chicken Alfredo 28 Ratings Skinny Alfredo Sauce 41 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
